Global economy braces for Trump's trade war and its consequences
description: After three months of tumultuous negotiations, the US is preparing to unveil trade agreements with its main partner countries by July 9. But the announcement of tariff hikes, followed by numerous reversals, has already begun to undermine the foundations of global growth.

'Europeans are more wary than ever of a hastily negotiated deal between Washington and Tehran'
description: With the US president saying he has 'nothing to offer' Iran and Tehran refusing to negotiate with Israel's main ally, the diplomatic outlook for a negotiated solution remains extremely uncertain, writes Le Monde's Philippe Ricard in his column.

headline: Michael Madsen, 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Kill Bill' star, dead at 67
description: The US actor, best known for his frequent collaborations with director Quentin Tarantino, died Thursday after suffering cardiac arrest, his management team said. Madsen was found unresponsive at his home in Malibu.

headline: The invisible transformation of Wimbledon's grass
description: Long dominated by serve-and-volley enthusiasts, the London tournament opted for a more resistant grass in 2001, which lengthened rallies and allowed less offensive players to dominate, including Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic.

headline: Water shortages in the upper Indian Himalayas are causing 'villages to die out and traditions to disappear'
description: 'The Himalayas Overheating'  (4/6). Zanskar, located in the Ladakh region of India's mountain highlands, has felt the full force of glacier retreat. With no access to water, villagers have been abandoning their homes and traditional way of life.

In Germany, Syrians still do not feel fully assimilated
description: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (2/5). Thanks to former chancellor Angela Merkel's asylum policy, Germany has taken in nearly half the Syrians seeking refuge in Europe since 2015. One of them, Amer Alqadi, a 39-year-old married father and naturalized citizen, believes that while the country still needs immigrants, its political climate has grown more tense.

headline: French foreign minister on Iran's nuclear program: 'It is essential that our security interests be taken into account'
description: Jean-Noël Barrot says France and Europe have a role to play in resolving conflicts in the Middle East and Ukraine.
byline: Claire Gatinois,  Philippe Ricard and  Stéphanie Le Bars

headline: Anne Deysine, US law expert: 'We are experiencing the dawn of a lawless society'
description: In an interview, Anne Deysine, a US law specialist, explains that the US Supreme Court's June 27 ruling would lead to institutional 'chaos,' as Trump is now able to keep changing US institutions and society through his executive orders, which are often illegal.
